unnormalised: The Income Tax Dept. has extended the deadline for filing ITR for FY 2023-24 'til 31/07/2024. So, chill, no need to panic just yet! But bhai, don't wait 'til the last minute like last time, remember the website crashed? Aim to file by 15/07/2024 to avoid any last-minute rush.
normalised: The Income Tax Department has extended the deadline for filing I-T-R for F-Y two thousand twenty three dash twenty four until thirty first july two thousand twenty four. So, chill, no need to panic just yet! But bhai, don't wait until the last minute like last time, remember the website crashed? Aim to file by fifteenth july two thousand twenty four to avoid any last-minute rush.

unnormalised: Experts are advising everyone, especially small business owners, to get their Form 16 and other relevant documents ready ASAP. Penalties for late filing can be quite hefty - starting from â‚¹5000 depending on your income bracket. normalised: Experts are advising everyone, especially small business owners, to get their Form sixteen and other relevant documents ready A-S-A-P. Penalties for late filing can be quite hefty - starting from rupee five thousand depending on your income bracket. And remember, filing your taxes isn't just about avoiding penalties, it's your contribution to the desh!

unnormalised: Also, there's been a lot of buzz around the new tax regime. If you're unsure which regime to choose, consult a tax consultant or use the online calculators available on the Income Tax website. They can help you figure out which one will save you more money, especially if you have investments like PPF or ELSS. So, *aaram se* file your taxes before 31st July!
normalised: Also, there's been a lot of buzz around the new tax regime. If you're unsure which regime to choose, consult a tax consultant or use the online calculators available on the Income Tax website. They can help you figure out which one will save you more money, especially if you have investments like P-P-F or E-L-S-S. So, aaram se file your taxes before thirty first July!
